title: EUROFIT: Integration, Homogenisation and Extension of the Scope Anthropometric Data Stored in Large EU Pools

author: Juan Carlos González García, IBV – Biomechanics Institute of Valencia

segmentation: Good morning, my name is Juan Carlos Gonzalez and even the director of the clothing Department of the Institute of Bio Mechanics of Valencia, and we coordinate the Eurofit project that I'm going to present today.
Over the last decade there have been.
Using that, the metrics, the measurements of human body to improve the interaction of product and environments with the people.
The classical applications have been, for example, the adaptation of the workplace with one dimensional measurements, and this application has been extended also to the consumer goods industries.
For example, the car industry fashion or the design of furniture.
In recent years, the development of new technologies for gathering the anthropological data, the 3D scanners have increased the ability at availability of digit digital anthropometric and resources.
